p: Studies has identified and quantified chemical compounds of A. rosaeodora essential oil, revealing that this species has chemotypes similar to essential oil extracted in Belém, state of Pará, Brazil, with linalool (84.8%) as the major compound, followed by α-terpineol (2.9%), geraniol (1.0%), benzyl benzoate (0.6%) and minimal amounts of monoterpene hydrocarbons and oxygenated sesquiterpenes (9.2%) [ 15]. The same was observed in the study of A. rosaeodora essential oil extracted in São Paulo, Brazil, where the presence of linalool (81.45%), trans-linalool oxide (1.19%), R-terpineol (1.09%) were observed [ 16]. Almeida et al. (2013) also reported that linalool is the main compound in essential oil obtained from wood, leaves and branches of the Brazilian rosewood [ 17].
